summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. DiIorio to various judges, SEC officials, and others, alleging massive, ongoing securities fraud, money laundering, and criminal obstruction by the SEC and related entities. The author details interconnected schemes involving companies like Riot Blockchain (RIOT), Virtu Financial (NITE/VIRT), and various OTC market shells, implicating numerous individuals in financial crimes and accusing the SEC of actively facilitating and covering up these frauds.

persons.name: Christopher J. DiIorio
persons.context: The author of the emails, alleging widespread SEC corruption, securities fraud, and money laundering related to Knight Capital, Riot Blockchain, and other entities. He claims to be the source of information for multiple SEC actions for which he has been denied whistleblower awards.

persons.name: Chad Everett Harris
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the Whinstone data center in Texas, which was bought and sold by Northern Data/Northern Bitcoin.

persons.name: Mathis Schultz
persons.role: Former Private Banker, Founder of Northern Data
persons.context: Founder of Northern Data in 2015. Northern Data owns a stake in Riot Blockchain (RIOT).

persons.name: Dougie Cifu
persons.context: Repeatedly accused of knowingly lying about NITE/VIRT's equity market making share volumes to conceal illegal naked shorting and money laundering activities on the OTC markets.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.role: Alleged money launderer, associated with NewLead, Magna, etc.
persons.context: Named in SEC actions that the whistleblower claims are based on his information. Connected to multiple alleged money laundering shells like NewLead, FreeSeas, and Inergetics.

persons.name: John M. Fife
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for dealing in penny stocks. Connected to Chicago Venture Partners and alleged involvement with MGT Capital.

persons.name: Justin W. Keener
persons.role: Alleged unregistered penny stock dealer (JMJ Financial)
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for operating as an unregistered dealer. The whistleblower claims this action is based on his information.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: Severely criticized for allegedly conducting a superficial investigation into Riot Blockchain (RIOT) and terminating it without visiting the company's claimed headquarters, thus facilitating ongoing fraud.

persons.name: Ms. Pasquinelli
persons.context: Addressed directly by the whistleblower regarding the SEC's failure to post eligible whistleblower award actions and ongoing frauds.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.role: Alleged 'Prolific Bag Man' and money launderer
persons.context: Central figure accused of controlling multiple money laundering shells, including MGT Capital, Aspenbio/Venaxis/Bioptix (which became Riot Blockchain), and Inergetics. Connected to Stetson, Frost, and others.

persons.name: Stetson
persons.context: Sidekick to Barry Honig, involved in money laundering shells like Therapix (now SciSparc) and Bioptix/RIOT.

persons.name: Robert Eide
persons.context: Head of Aegis Capital, a firm accused of being a prolific OTC/NASDAQ shell money launderer. His pension plan is noted as a seller in a SciSparc filing.

persons.name: Kevin McKenna
persons.context: Named alongside Robert Eide in FINRA/SEC actions related to Aegis Capital's violations.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Convicted of healthcare fraud, entered into a fraudulent purchase agreement with Millennium Biotech (later Inergetics), and became a large shareholder. Connected to Barry Honig and Joshua Sason.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.role: Former DOJ Prosecutor, now Federal Judge
persons.context: Was the prosecutor on Brian Colleran's civil healthcare fraud case. Appointed as a federal judge by Trump.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.role: CEO of Rusnano USA Inc., former head of Russian Federal Energy Agency
persons.context: Appears as an insider in Bioptix/Alphasniffer (precursor to RIOT). His involvement raises national security concerns about Russian ties to the alleged money laundering shell.

persons.name: Mark B. Fisher
persons.role: Owner of MBF Clearing Corp and MBF Capital
persons.context: His entities were involved in a fraud 'acquisition' by Riot Blockchain, facilitated by law firm Sichenzia Ross. Based in New York but transaction listed as 'Miami', potentially linked to corrupt SEC Director Eric Bustilloe.

persons.name: Eric Bustilloe
persons.context: Accused of being a 'grossly corrupt Piece of Shit' on par with Gottschall, potentially connected to the Miami aspect of the Mark Fisher/RIOT transaction.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: His sentencing by Judge Cote is called a 'gross miscarriage of justice', allegedly set up by Handler/Jefferies and Ares Management because he interfered with their deal.

persons.name: Handler
persons.role: Associated with Jefferies and Ares Management
persons.context: Alleged to have a corrupt relationship with the SEC and to have set up Dan Kamensky for interfering with an Ares Management deal (Neiman Marcus).

persons.name: Ressler
persons.context: Co-founder of Ares Management (with Drexel background, like Handler). Allegedly involved in setting up Dan Kamensky to protect the value of the Neiman Marcus asset.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.context: San Diego resident who is CFO of several OTC Pink sheet companies (Viper Networks, Santeon Group, etc.), alleged to be involved in money laundering schemes known to the SEC's LA office.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.context: CEO of Santeon Group, an alleged money laundering shell with ties to African/Egyptian entities.

connections.description: Described as associates working together on multiple alleged money laundering shells, including Bioptix/Therapix/SciSparc and MGT Capital.
Connected through overlapping investments in alleged money laundering shells like Inergetics/Millennium Biotech.
Fife's firm (Iliad) was involved in MGT Capital, a Honig shell, just before its registration was revoked.
Both named in FINRA/SEC actions against Aegis Capital Corp for violations related to anti-money laundering rules.
DiIorio directly and repeatedly attacks Gottschall for corruptly terminating the RIOT investigation without a proper visit, facilitating fraud.
DiIorio alleges the SEC is knowingly letting Cifu lie about share volumes and conceal illegal activity, thus facilitating fraud.
Readler was the DOJ prosecutor on Colleran's civil healthcare fraud case, which resulted in a settlement rather than criminal charges.
Akhanov was an insider/investor in Bioptix/Alphasniffer, the company that pivoted to become Riot Blockchain, implying Russian financial ties.
Law firm Sichenzia Ross facilitated the fraudulent 'acquisition' of Fisher's trading platform by Riot Blockchain.
Both have Drexel backgrounds and are connected through Ares Management and the Neiman Marcus deal.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. DiIorio, alleges the SEC is engaged in systematic criminal obstruction and corruption, actively facilitating massive securities fraud and money laundering while denying him rightful whistleblower awards.

Riot Blockchain (RIOT) is alleged to be a non-operational 'Honig money laundering shell' that only exists in SEC filings, with its official address co-located with an ISP and a Pakistani BPO company, not a legitimate business.

Virtu Financial (VIRT/NITE) is accused of being the core facilitator of illegal naked shorting on OTC markets to launder money, with CEO Dougie Cifu knowingly lying about share volumes to conceal this activity, aided by SEC inaction.

Russian ties are raised as a national security concern, with Dmitry Akhanov (CEO of Rusnano USA, former Russian Federal Energy Agency head) being an insider in Bioptix, the precursor company to Riot Blockchain.

The document claims multiple successful SEC enforcement actions (against Sason, Fife, Keener) were based on the whistleblower's information but were fraudulently kept off the official whistleblower award eligibility list to deny him compensation.
